Introduction

Lee Hyori is a South Korean singer-songwriter, record producer, and actress affiliated with Antenna. She gained fame as part of the girl group Fin.K.L and the collaborative projects, coed-group SSAK3 (as Linda G) and Refund Sisters (as Chun Ok).

Lee Hyori has had a diverse and successful career in the music industry. She first rose to prominence as the leader of the girl group Fin.K.L, debuting with their album “Blue Rain” on May 28, 1998. Despite being inactive since 2002, the group reunited for special comebacks in 2005 and 2019.

Launching her solo career on August 18, 2003, with the album “Stylish...” Lee Hyori established herself as a versatile solo artist.

In 2020, she was involved in two project groups. Under the name Linda G, she was part of the co-ed group SSAK3, releasing the single “Beach Again'' before disbanding on August 15, 2020. She also joined the all-female group Refund Sisters as Chun Ok, releasing the single “Don’t Touch Me” and disbanding on November 14, 2020.

Beyond her professional life, Lee Hyori is married to guitarist Lee Sang Soon. They tied the knot on September 1, 2013, at their vacation home in Mt. Halla Jeju Island.

On May 15, 2020, she signed an exclusive contract with ESteem Entertainment and was followed by her husband joining the agency a few days later.
